subject: Mental Health
title: The Rosenhan Experiment
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Rosenhan Experiment.

hook.text: Eight sane people got admitted to psychiatric hospitals by faking one single symptom.

buildup.text: In 1973, David Rosenhan sent pseudopatients who claimed to hear the word thud.

discovery.text: All were admitted and diagnosed with schizophrenia despite acting completely normal.

twist.text: Staff never detected the fakes, but real patients did: you're not crazy, they said.

climax.text: The study questioned whether psychiatry could distinguish the sane from the insane.

punchline.text: If you can't tell who's sick, can you tell who's well?

quiz.question: What did the Rosenhan experiment demonstrate?
options: Psychiatric hospitals couldn't reliably distinguish sane from insane
